entry.title: So, You Want to Join a Startup?
entry.content: So, you are an amazing technie/engineer and you are bustling with ideas. You think, “I’d like to join a startup to make a pile of money.” Well, think harder. Unless otherwise you want to start your own company, the reality is something rather different. Things have gotten quite out-of-hand in recent times, and [other] (http://www.businessinsider.com/this-22-year-veteran-of-startups-says-employees-are-getting-screwed-by-vcs-and-ceos-2014-3?fb_action_ids=427078274093582&fb_action_types=og.recommends&fb_source=other_multiline&action_object_map=%7B%22427078274093582%22%3A225001791037273%7D&action_type_map=%7B%22427078274093582%22%3A%22og.recommends%22%7D&action_ref_map=%5B%5D) [folks] (http://rob.by/2013/negotiating-your-startup-job-offer/) [have spoken] (http://venturehacks.com/articles/option-pool-shuffle#market) [about the issue] (http://cdixon.org/2009/08/27/the-one-number-you-should-know-about-your-equity-grant/).
